course.title: AJAX Complete Tutorial
course.description: A complete end-to-end guide to AJAX covering XMLHttpRequest, server communication, XML, PHP, ASP, databases, and real-world examples.

lesson.title: AJAX, XMLHttpRequest, XML, and Server Integration

introduction.overview: AJAX (Asynchronous JavaScript And XML) enables asynchronous communication between a web browser and a server, allowing parts of a web page to update without reloading.
benefits: Read data from a web server after page load
Update parts of a web page dynamically
Send data to a server in the background

xmlhttprequest_object.overview: The XMLHttpRequest object is the foundation of classic AJAX and is supported by all modern browsers.

GET.description: Used for fast and simple data retrieval.

POST.description: Used for sending large or sensitive data.

sending_requests.asynchronous_note: Asynchronous requests are recommended. Synchronous requests can block the browser and are discouraged.

callbacks_and_ready_state.onload: Triggered when the request has completed successfully.

ready_states.4: Request finished and response is ready

properties.responseText: Returns the response as a string
properties.responseXML: Returns the response as an XML DOM object

php.description: PHP script filters names and returns matching suggestions.

asp.description: ASP script searches name array and returns results.

database_integration.overview: AJAX can retrieve database records dynamically without reloading the page.

modern_alternative.fetch_api: Modern browsers support the Fetch API, which provides a simpler and cleaner alternative to XMLHttpRequest.

key_takeaways: XMLHttpRequest is the foundation of classic AJAX
AJAX works with XML, PHP, ASP, and databases
Fetch API is the modern replacement for XMLHttpRequest
